div.div:
Matt - May 10, 2012 - Version 3.2.6
Disappointed: HTC Amaze; Glacier; Sensation
Polite, intelligible requests for support go unanswered. Market licence errors too often prevent access to an app I paid for upon It's initial release. Frankly, I'd like a refund and be done with this fiasco. Personal struggles aside, the app is quite a ways from being worth a price tag. This app should have undergone extensive beta testing prior to market release, and even then it should have been placed in the market in beta to iron out the kinks. Proceed with caution.

Jason - April 12, 2012 - Motorola Droid X with version 3.2.6
Most fun app I own.
I bought this after becoming incredibly addicted to the lite version. It takes some trial and error but once you get the hang of it you will love it!

Paul - May 5, 2012 - Version 3.2.6
Rom magic
If you have problems, contact the dev. They get back to you quick, and can usually fix it quick too. Putting ur problem here doesn't help u or them. This app rocks!

Chris - May 28, 2012 - HTC EVO 3D with version 3.2.6
Incredible on HTC EVO 3D!
Works great you just got to read the manual, and use google for issues. I haven't had many and love this. It's like dual booting my pc!

Pretty awesome app

Ed - April 24, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 3.2.6
Okay but can be better!
App does what as its intended but why have an option to set up a kernal name but its not compatible with flashing kernals on rom slots 1,2,3, etc...? Will rate 5 stars once this is fix galaxy nexus LTE Edit: I rated 5 stars dev got back with me fast. Problem is with the Franco Kernal having issues seeing the SD card if flashed through boot manager and they are looking into fixing it thanks.

Vernon - May 17, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 3.2.6
Just watched the video...

This app has my vote as most useful to from flashers for sure

Robert - May 13, 2012 - Version 3.2.6
Very cool

I restored the backup of my phone ROM (CleanROM DE 1.4) and installed slot 1 ROM (Ineffabilis Deus 1.0) from the nandroid and can now run either with no problems.

May be I am doing something wrong. But I watched the video multiple times and followed the steps. I do not need a refund. I like the dev make this app more compatible with various devices and tested before releasing the paid version. This is a great idea and wish it works perfect soon! Kudos for Dev!!

Then came across this app and purchased the pro version (for a very reasonable price). I am very glad I did. It works really well and is really responsive on my class 10 micro SD. Very impressed. Great work Devs. As I say, purchased app to support Developers. Great work.

Zach - April 26, 2012 - Motorola Droid X with version 3.2.6
Needs a lot of work.
Initially, this was a great app. I loved the ability to easily flash from within the phone. However, this app is nothing more than a headache anymore. The app was meant to be able to try many different types of roms.. however, I would say around the last 2 or 3 roms I've flashed have resulted in a phone that refused to boot, losing access to recovery completely, and then resulting in a SBF. Everytime. At this point it's way easier to just flash from Clockwork Recovery than it is this app. Less headache, and I usually don't end with a phone that can only be SBF'd. It gets quite annoying when you have to constantly SBF. Maybe it's my luck, but as of now, I wouldn't recommend this to anyone until I see either better ROM compatibility, or just fixing whatever is wrong with the dang app. It's pathetic.

Panagiotis - March 16, 2012 - HTC G2 with version 3.2.3
Good idea but many problems...
The idea is indeed very good, but the implementation has many problems. I have tried two AOSP ICS roms and one MIUI ICS. They all boot fine, but none of them have working WiFi. If you flash normally the rom, make a nandroid backup and restore it from there, the WiFi does work. But this is a whole lot of trouble and requires time, making the whole point of the app pretty wasted... I also tried two ICS Sense roms (one Sense 3.6 and another Sense 4.0). None of them even booted. And I have activated the large boot.img and I have also resized the img's... So in conclusion: The app is probably not very suitable if you want to try the most recent roms, which is exactly what most people would want it for. At least now there is a lite version (which did not exist when I bought the app...), so you can test before hand if it works for you. HTC Desire Z (Vision)
